results.title: Newspapers: a reading adventure
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallen and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Presents an explanation of the various sections of a newspaper. Shows how a story is gathered and written; the types of articles that are printed; and how to read a paper for maximum information.

results.title: Ballad of Lucy Jordan
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the song by Dr. Hook, using mainly photographic stills to tell the sad and ironic tale of a thirty seven year old house wife whose daydreams lead only to despair.

results.title: Astronauts and jellybeans
results.creator_credit: Dan Bessie, Severo Perez and Learning Garden
results.brief_description: Animation and live action are used to outline the development of the spoken and written language, beginning with the earliest diagrammatic and pictorial forms of communication. Notes the importance of the written word, the use of the dictionary, and the sound of words.

results.title: We are of the soil
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau and Iowa State University Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
Highlights the consequences of erosion due to wind, water and overworking of the soil, as well as outlining some possible erosion control techniques. Also considers with whom the responsibility for control of soil erosion lies.
Suitable for middle and uppeer secondary levels.

results.title: Moving still
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Uses archival material to show the development of early photography, from the first photograph of 1827 through to the first slow motion study in 1901. Also illustrates how scientists, designers and engineers use time-lapse cameras to cheat time; to look beyond our human perceptions; and to study the world of high and low-speed activity.

results.title: A Voyage through the cosmos
results.creator_credit: Adrian Malone, Gregory Andorfer, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In a spaceship of the imagination, we start a journey from a far-off region of the universe and gradually approach planet Earth. Dr Carl Sagan, our guide, manoeuvres the ship between galaxies of many kinds, near quasars and supernovae, through clouds of gas and dust from which future stars will be born, and past the planets to our own. Adapted from Cosmos the television series by Carl Sagan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adrian Malone, Gregory Andorfer, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)

results.title: The Eye: an inside story
results.brief_description: Reveals the various parts of the eye and the functions of each part, as well as showing the mechanics of this complex organ and how the phenomenon of vision is accomplished. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Blood: composition and functions
results.brief_description: Microphotography shows three cellular components of the blood and their functions. Time-lapse photography clearly indicates coagulation and fibrin formation; and the manufacture of cells in bone marrow from primitive cells is examined. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Electromagnetic spectrum
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Provides demonstrations of ultra-violet and infra-red radiation, radio waves and microwaves and shows the application of reflection of light in medical technology particularly X-ray machines, broadcasting and microwave ovens. Suitable for upper secondary level.
